Jokowi Ajak Perbankan Pikirkan Penurunan Suku Bunga Acuan
06 Nov 2019, 14:00 by Pradipta Rahadi


Jokowi Ajak Perbankan Pikirkan Penurunan Suku Bunga Acuan

KBRN, Jakarta : Presiden Joko Widodo mengajak sektor perbankan dan keuangan untuk mulai memikirkan penurunan Suku Bunga Kredit Acuan di Indonesia. Presiden melihat, di berbagai negara belahan dunia, sudah mulai menurunkan Suku Bunga Kredit mereka secara perlahan-lahan. Sayangnya, hal tersebut belum berlaku di Indonesia. Hal itu disampaikan Kepala Negara saat menghadiri Indonesia Banking Expo di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta pada Rabu (06/11/19). 
"Saya mengajak kepada semua pelaku perbankan untuk mulai memikirkan secara serius, untuk menurunkan Suku Bunga Kredit. Negara lain sudah turun, turun, turun, kita BI-rate sudah turun, (suku bunga) bank-nya belum. Ini saya tunggu,” ujar Presiden Jokowi disambut tepuk tangan.  
Sontak saja dengan melihat dan mendengar langsung banyaknya tepuk tangan, Kepala Negara dengan nada bercanda berharap akan ada respon positif dari para pelaku perbankan. 
"Tepuk tangan berarti setuju,” tambah Presiden yang disambut dengan tawa para peserta yang memenuhi ruangan acara. Sebelumnya, Bank Indonesia diprediksi akan menurunkan suku bunga acuan BI 7-Days Reverse Repo Rate (7DRRR) hingga 4,5% pada tahun depan untuk menghadapi prospek aktivitas ekonomi global yang melambat.Hingga akhir tahun ini, suku bunga BI7DRR diprediksi masih akan ditahan Bank Indonesia pada level 5% di tengah inflasi yang diprediksi masih terkendali.Untuk diketahui, sepanjang tahun ini, bank sentral sudah menurunkan suku bunga acuan 7DRRR empat kali, dimana satu kali pemangkasan dilakukan pekan lalu, yang sesuai dengan prediksi pelaku pasar. Mengacu pada catatan BI, pemangkasan suku bunga 4 kali sebanyak 100 basis poin (bps), yakni pada 18 Juli sebesar 5,75%, kemudian pada 22 Agustus sebesar 5,50%, lalu pada 19 September sebesar 5,25%, dan 24 Oktober lalu di level 5%.

Jokowi Invites Banks to Think About Decrease in Reference Interest Rates
Nov 6 2019, 2:00 PM by Pradipta Rahadi


Jokowi Invites Banks to Think About Decrease in Reference Interest Rates

KBRN, Jakarta: President Joko Widodo invites the banking and financial sectors to start thinking about reducing the Reference Credit Rates in Indonesia. The President sees, in various countries around the world, that they have started to slowly lower their lending rates. Unfortunately, this does not yet apply in Indonesia. This was conveyed by the Head of State when attending the Indonesia Banking Expo at the Fairmont Hotel, Jakarta on Wednesday (06/11/19).
"I invite all banking players to start thinking seriously, to reduce lending rates. Other countries have gone down, down, down, we have decreased the BI-rate, (bank interest rates) yet. I am waiting for this," he said. President Jokowi was applauded.
Suddenly by seeing and hearing first hand the amount of applause, the Head of State jokingly hoped that there would be a positive response from the banking players.
"Applause means agreeing," added the President, who was greeted with laughter from the participants who filled the event space. Previously, Bank Indonesia was predicted to reduce the BI 7-Days Reverse Repo Rate (7DRRR) interest rate to 4.5% next year to face prospect of slowing global economic activity. Until the end of this year, the BI7DRR interest rate is predicted to be held by Bank Indonesia at the 5% level in the midst of inflation which is predicted to be still under control. , where one cut was carried out last week, in accordance with market players' predictions Referring to BI notes, the interest rate cut was 4 times 100 basis points (bps), ie on July 18 by 5.75%, then on August 22 by 5 , 50%, then on September 19 at 5.25%, and last October at the level of 5%.
